website_summaries.verdict: Affordable heavy-duty bags ideal for salvage sites; a useful tool against flood protection. Can also be used for sandbag training.
pros: Features a double-sewn bottom for extra strength
Heavy-duty 850 denier count material with UV protection for up to 1,600 hours
The hemmed top makes these easy to fill
cons: Small gaps in seams can leak sand

customer_reviews.title: They are sandbags
customer_reviews.text: If you order 20 sandbags, and 20 bags claiming to be sandbags show up, you need to verify that they do in fact contain sand, and are, therefore, sandbags, not just regular bags unsuitable for sand. After extensive experimenting, mostly involving dumping sand into them, I can confirm that yes, they do hold sand. I can therefore conclude that these are, in fact, sandbags.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sand bags to hold sand to train for Spartan
customer_reviews.text: The bags work. Made to hold sand and that is what they do. I'm training for a Spartan Obstacle course and these bag are perfect for holding sand, and I can measure the exact weight of the same bag I want to create, take it all up and now I have a sand bag to carry around and build my strength.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: What a joke
customer_reviews.text: UV protection???? What a joke. The bags fall apart within six months when left outside in the sun. If you want something that will last, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy sand bags
customer_reviews.text: With recent heavy rains I got water in a window well that never had a problem before. Discovered it ran from a downspout and flowed in an area I didn’t expect. I believe placing a few sandbags in the area of the well cover will resolve issue. Easily filled three sandbags from a 50 lb. bag of sand. Built in ties made sealing them very easy, plus allowed me to shape bags to fit where needed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N. OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Will not withstand Strongman training
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for quarantine workouts. These were the highest rated bags so I figured if these can't last strongman workouts, none can. Put two 50lb bags into my Ironminds cordura bag, trained. The bags burst 1/4 way into the workout. I don't really blame the bags, they weren't designed for that sort of impact training. Just giving anyone a heads up who was searching for an at home workout solution
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mastson

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality Sandbags!
customer_reviews.text: Each of these holds nearly exactly 5 gallons of sand... I'm not sure the weight on that, but I ripped one "full" sandbag open (to spread some sand by hand on the area under a brick walkway that I was installing) and it exactly filled a 5 gallon bucket - that info might be useful if you're trying to calculate how much sand to get to fill 100 bags or whatnot... Each bag has a built-in tie, to cinch off the filled sandbag, so that is extremely nice... Very high quality, haven't had one inadvertently bust/break on me yet... Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a very good product.
customer_reviews.text: Just got the sand bags and have filled them with sand. The bags full of sand are waiting for snow so i can put them into the back of my truck and will be able to tell if the bags hold sand being used and will stand up under wear. But the bags sitting in my yard doing nothing have not had a grain of sand make it's way out. Will be back and review again when under use.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good but not Bulletproof
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 200 of these for a beach bank erosion control project. Decent quality for the price. I sourced very similar bags from the local hardware store at 50 cents each. These came in at under 3 cents each. No brainer to buy on Amazon. They were not as substantial as the bags we used years ago, but these will be out of the sun and should last a long time. I definitely recommend them for light to medium use and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: heatherk7

customer_reviews.title: These do not last.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these sandbags for two months and within the first month they started disintegrating. They were not moved excessively nor over filled. Now I have to deal with piles of sand throughout my fields. I'm sure many folks in need of sandbags have expectations of not having to rebuy and refill every few weeks, which is what I would have to do to maintain these.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Strong, Durable, and Perfect for Storing Extra Sand
customer_reviews.text: These bags are fantastic and have far exceeded my expectations! I was torn between a few different brands and decided to go with thee. They are strong, durable, and I received fifty of them for a great price. We used these when we had some excess sand from a pool installation. We wanted to hold on to some of the sand for miscellaneous projects, and this was a great option for us. We filled up a bunch of bags and put them in the shed for later use. The polypropylene material is durable and has a tight weave, so nothing leaks out. Overall...great quality...great value! I highly recommend and I would definitely purchase these again if I need more!
customer_reviews.author: NCKelly

customer_reviews.title: These were perfect for my landscaping project (building a pond wall)
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my landscaping project (building a pond wall). Mouth opens wider than the typical garden spade, but use a DIY sandbag jig for real efficiency:  Tie strings are attached in a loop that makes closing and tying easy. Full bag holds about 40 pounds, be we found half filling made the bags both easier to move around but more flexible in stacking and shaping. Used all 100 and then found bags at a local hardware store that were not as good, so returned those and order another set of these.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Filled with sand and looks nice outside a window well.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted for color, price, and size. The longevity of this product may be not quite as lasting as desired. However, I am using these in a window well to insure an extra barrier of waterproofing. Then covered them with a clear plastic shield- it looks very nice with these bags filled with sand.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Great bags!
customer_reviews.text: These bags seem as tough as any I have bought in the past. I use these bags to shore up places in my irrigation ditches that may leak or wash out. We have clay soil that washes easily so these bags work better than just more dirt in wash-outs. So far the bags I put out a few weeks ago are holding up well despite the intense sun.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rieke

customer_reviews.title: All tore
customer_reviews.text: Tore first week filled with only 40 pounds of sand Gorilla tape on all now Junk
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Holds a Bunch of Rocks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to stabilize my deck umbrella. I filled the bags with landscaping rock and they have held up with no punctures. I used the landscaping rocks instead of sand in case the bags ever break. It's easier to pick up rock than it is sand.
customer_reviews.author: Brother O

customer_reviews.title: This way I can pull the gravel back out easily if I need to bring the planter in for ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to put pea gravel in to act as ballast in the bottom of a long and tall but very skinny front-porch planter. This way I can pull the gravel back out easily if I need to bring the planter in for a hurricane. Filling these only part of the way enabled me to squish them narrow enough to fit inside. They seem plenty strong and the built-in ties really grip.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Are you even kidding me?
customer_reviews.text: As you can see, these bags disintegrated almost entirely...this is over the span of about 3 months! They filled up easily with sand (we are using them to weigh down tarps), loved the tie attached at the top...we were hoping to use these for YEARS and are super disappointed. We filled each only 1/3-1/2 full and can't figure out why they are basically evaporating. $ wasted on bags and on the sand to fill them!!!!
customer_reviews.author: WhyFoodWorks with Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last more than a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: The bags simply disintegrate into mush. After 2 weeks the rain would tear right through them. The ones on the bottom (had them piled up with tied opening up) didn't get as much sun exposure nor rain and still when I tried to life them they just busted right in my hands. Waste of money. You're better off using grocery store plastic bags.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Ghaly

customer_reviews.title: They will bust after about a year in outside exposure
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I had expected. I used these bags to put torn worn bags in. I put the old bags into these new bags for sand. Over time, if left outside they will wear due to heat and ice. But, I'm going to put a contractor's bag to cover them while not in use. This will allow longer life of the bags.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry N. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: they are working for my project!
customer_reviews.text: I am using these bags to transport sand from the front of my house to the back of my house. when I got the bags I was a little concerned that the bags would not hold up to continuous use (I have filled, emptied and re-filled each bag 10 times already and only 1/4 done with my project.) although they are fraying a bit at the top, the bags are holding up very well (40lbs. of sand in each bag each trip).
customer_reviews.author: steve swank

customer_reviews.title: Sand bag with good ties.
customer_reviews.text: They look good, ties are strong and right length, they feel sturdy. As far as durability, hopefully they will perform better than others that deteriorate even with no sunlight -time will tell. Value for money will be dependent on performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jaqueline dM

customer_reviews.title: They do what you expect most of the time.... Hold sand.
customer_reviews.text: The only negative that I could give here is that some of them came ripped out of the package. This is not really a negative but it's more sort of a grey area issue, the ties are located a little low when you fill it up with 50 pounds of sand so the tying is hard unless you relocated the included tie. Some had to be retied with rope strands to close a hole made by the ties. Otherwise the bags did their job of keeping a flood of water out of my outside garage during heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Gonna buy more
customer_reviews.text: We like that they're easy to fill and tie, we had a stormshelter put in, and had a ton of dirt that didn't come get picked up, so I used them to lower the pile, and transfer dirt to other places, and you never know when you'll need them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sandbags do the job
customer_reviews.text: Was able to put sand in the bags and redirect water flow - all done pretty easy - only put 25 to 30 pounds of sand in each bag. 10 to 15 will work nice for tight and small spots. I was not too sure about the plastic ties used for closure would stand up over time. Wish they were of a design that would allow for reopening to make volume adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: Product ties are very light weight plastic. I used ...
customer_reviews.text: Product ties are very light weight plastic.I used tie wire to secure them. Bag is said to hold 50# and that's true IF you don't have to tie the bag closed. If you do, 50# will prevent you from closing the bag. Durability of the tyvek appears high as I've used them in intense sunshine for months without any problems. I would likely repurchase these if I needed more.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Better than waiting in line
customer_reviews.text: The line for free sandbags was too long so we Bought these before Hurricane Irma and used sand from our yard. After the urricane we emptied the bags to fill the spot we took the sand from and then recycled the bags. Much better than waiting in a 2 hour line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't last 10 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I filled sand bags and laid out along garage doors in July--came back 10 weeks later and attempted to pick them up--the material gave way in my hands and ripped with only 1⁄2 full bags of sand--
customer_reviews.author: Hank Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Durable and strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bags again to have extras and because they work great for what I use them for. I use these for holding in place a home made boxing stand which is 9ft long and 9ft high. I put them on the legs of the stand because it holds the stand from moving forward, backwards and any other way when I'm hitting the punching bags. These sand bags are very durable, strong and inexpensive. I filled them up with sand weighing 50 to 60lbs each and they never ripped. I like that they come with ties attached to them. I recommend these to anybody that's looking for sand bags.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Strong sand bags, to use again and again!
customer_reviews.text: The sandbags are good choice for inclimate weather conditions. We are in Florida and always awaiting the next hurricane season. Very handy and well made ready for use. They seem to be very strong and hold up well. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Henry

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 10 got 8
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the 10 pack of sand bags to weigh down my crown vics rear end for the winter. It did not come with 10, only 8 when I paid for 10. Aside from that I saw a small tear at the top of one after filling. Aside from that the bag seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were better quality than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: These were better quality than I was expecting. The bags come with ties so you can seal them quickly without much hassle. They are just big enough to stand up in a 5 gallon bucket and fill them. I got them in time to prepare for hurricane Mathew and they definitely helped.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon P. Deason

customer_reviews.title: Polypropylene is the way to go for sand bags
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace those cloth type sand bags that I used to pick up at a local fire station. The cloth sandbag only last perhaps 2 months. With polypropylene, these bags has lasted the whole summer and still going strong. Also, I notice the local fire station has also switched over to these type of sand bags this winter.
customer_reviews.author: wyln

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bags for many uses
customer_reviews.text: This is the second purchase I’ve made for these. I figured at least a 100 bags was a good start to hand on hand for an emergency and these have many uses. Long term storage and due to the material they should never deteriorate over time. Very happy with these and shipping also.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Smith

customer_reviews.title: really strong
customer_reviews.text: We are digging hole in clay and have been putting clay in some bags for wieght to hold down tarps and keep the garage in a box in place. We might make a wall with theese. you know a sand bag wall. nice product.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. truchon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, low quality bags
customer_reviews.text: These bags sat outside for less than 1 rainy season in Florida. The bags disintegrated and all the sand fell out upon trying to move them. Do not buy these! I even tried using them once more and double bagged them. Unfortunately the same thing happened. These might be good used indoors but do not hold up in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Good bags
customer_reviews.text: Well they're sand bags, they do allow fine dust to escape which is normal for most sand bags. They've been out in the Sun every day since I've had them which is about a month baking in the Florida Sun, I do feel like they are degrading a little bit feel brittlle / stiffer than when first filled new but, they have not ripped so so far so good. I have literally thrown HUNDREDS of sandbags out in the United States Army and these are comprable to the one I used there.
customer_reviews.author: Rattler

customer_reviews.title: Luck of the draw
customer_reviews.text: Quality control was all over the place as some bags were great and others felt thin and leaked sand immediately from the bottom where the seam was. Luckily there were a few extra bags in the box so I was able to double bag the ones that had bad leaks. Not sure how long they are going to last but so far I have little faith they will last very long.
customer_reviews.author: MRC

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the work it takes to fill them
customer_reviews.text: These bags only lasted about seven weeks before the sun baked the plastic fibers enough for them to start leaking sand. They were economical, but had very limited longevity.
customer_reviews.author: California husband & wife

customer_reviews.title: They disintegrated in about a month
customer_reviews.text: I have a silage tarp outside that I needed to put some weight on so it wouldn't blow away. I went through the trouble of buying these, buying sand, filling the bags, and placing them on the tarp. I went out a month later and these bags have disintegrated. I went to pick one up and all the sand fell out.... the bags have totally fallen apart. If anyone has any ideas of what sand bags will actually work while under the sun, I'd be happy for the suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Crouchy

customer_reviews.title: bags
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. we didn't use the ties with the bags though, we were afraid they would come undone so we used zip ties. Filled with sand to hold down our pool cover from rolling when we have storms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bag will deteriorate and break within a month!!!
customer_reviews.text: These bags SU(K! I bought 100 of these bags, took time to fill them, and placed them on my side yard. After a month, two bags broke, then the rest over the next following weeks. When I tried to salvage and move them, the entire bag ripped into tiny pieces. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME FILLING THESE BAGS UP -- they will break and are worthless. I had to buy new bags of different brand to re bag the sand that have ALL broke!
customer_reviews.author: John Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: All signs point to rainier weather in eastern Pennsylvania as the climate shifts. These will nicely protect the window wells along the driveway, and prevent seepage into the basement during storms.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Porter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sand bags
customer_reviews.text: Quality product and easy to use. I filled about 30 of them and they hold dirt and sand well and are easy to tie closed. Hopefully they are just insurance and I will never need to use them for a flood but If we experience a flood, we're ready.
customer_reviews.author: WestM

customer_reviews.title: A sand bag that doesnt hold sand ??
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these bags with the idea of filling them up with sand to exercise. The problem is that the bag is woven so it isnt fully sealed. Sand will come out as you move the bag. That being said It is a great product for single use.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Well they work
customer_reviews.text: They're sandbags. Had to transfer sand from old busted sand tubes to these so I could take them to the dump. They lasted outside the 3 weeks it took me to get around to taking them to the dump without issue
customer_reviews.author: John J Novak

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Bags are alright. Heavy use for working out throwing the bag around will cause a blow out. The draw string isn't that useful either. Replaced it with 550 cord and used a clove hitch that held significantly better. I guess it would be good for stacking and light use.
customer_reviews.author: A Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good bags
customer_reviews.text: Photo of new unused bag and of one well used. Held up well under abuse. Easily fit 40 pounds of sand. Triple bagged because I knew I was going to pick it up and throw it on concrete for a quarter mile. As you can see in the photo it held well for something it was never meant for. Only the outside bag tore in one spot probably due to how I was grabbing and lifting from that point again and again. The stitching on bottom held up well. Overall only a bit of loosening in the weave near the bottom. Inner bags showing little wear and held the course sand with no visible leakage. Will continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Ortmann II

customer_reviews.title: Bad sand bag material
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month and they were already toasted and broken
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Thick bag, works for my small support projects
customer_reviews.text: Used these to weigh down privacy screens on an apartment balcony. Works perfectly well and experienced no problems. These bags cost cents to make and the price is steep.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Chino

customer_reviews.title: Dry rot not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Use these to weigh down the trampoline due to the wind and storms in our area. The bags don’t last a month, they dry rot and fall apart
customer_reviews.author: B. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: We use these to weigh down tarps on leaking roofs so we don't have to screw into the roof deck. Tie them to the grommets in the corners and wrap the long runs of the tarp with 2 x 4's and unless another hurricane comes, they're not going anywhere
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to weight down patio umbrellas in the wind. After just a few months, the fabric started to disintegrate. I'm now looking for a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Joe

customer_reviews.title: Bag man
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bags to transport stones at my Florida home to my cabin in Tennessee rather than throwing them in the trash, a long and heavy process. The bags have made multiple trips with no splits or problems. Comes with a tie cord that stays connected to the bag. I get 40 to 50 lbs. of material in each bag and they make transportation simple.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: These are just what I needed for my truck. ...
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I needed for my truck. I purchased 0.5 cuft sand bags from home depot and put the entire plastic bag with sand into these sand bags for extra protection. They were a tight fit but doable. Since the uv protection doesn't last longer than 2 months of direct sunlight that didn't matter to me as I have a tonneau cover. They should hold up for a few seasons, I hope
customer_reviews.author: OK chief

customer_reviews.title: Descent...
customer_reviews.text: Used for fitness bootcamp, needed to double bag sand when we were lifting. Im sure they would do there purpose for protecting during floods.
customer_reviews.author: Christian K.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice. Saved my cottage from flooding.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Filled them up with sand about 60%. Built a nice wall and saved my cottage from flooding. Not sure how long they will last, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing bags in that they are white and will deflect ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sand Bags - Empty White Woven Polypropylene Sandbags w/ Ties, w/ UV Protection; size: 14" x 26" , Qty of 10. These are amazing bags in that they are white and will deflect the sun well and they hold a lot of dirt, sand and small rocks. The bags are made really well. Totally pleased with these bags. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Dove

customer_reviews.title: Generic poly sandbag
customer_reviews.text: IT was easy to fill and easy to close. Using two to hold down my 13 ft umbrella. Would have liked to be able to only buy two (2) as that was all I needed. but not big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: durable bags
customer_reviews.text: We had wet sand bags that were starting to fall apart and we were able to slide them right into these new bags! The bags held up perfect and the ties on the end are an added bonus. We tied them shut and placed them where we needed them to stop water from our neighbors run off in his yard. The bags are a very nice quality for the money. I am sorry I didn't order more, but will be soon.
customer_reviews.author: Michele S

customer_reviews.title: UpNorth Sand Bags - Empty White Woven Polypropylene Sandbags w/Ties
customer_reviews.text: UpNorth Sand Bags - Empty White Woven Polypropylene Sandbags w/Ties I've Used Better,,, But they are working so far..
customer_reviews.author: Waine E. Newland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Find
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the big box stores and they acted like I was speaking a foreign language. 10 second search yielded these and they worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Graham

customer_reviews.text: I keep these on hand to use with 18 pound bags of kitty litter inside when a hurricane is near. I have reused them many times
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: size matters....
customer_reviews.text: The are kind of gigantic. Bigger than what I expected but they will do the trick. I would rather they were half the size.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: What bad weather?
customer_reviews.text: Bought for unforeseen weather issues in Florida. No issues n attached ties wonderful. I filled 35 w/o an issue. Sewing of edges gud.
customer_reviews.author: dralexy

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Have had sand in bags anchoring base for large umbrella for 3 months so far and bags have held up ,it might take a full year to wear out but I only used 4 bags out of 10 sent in order so I have replacements which is nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sand tight.....if that's the right term.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these sand bags for their weight, and not to prevent flooding. One of my requirements was that they not leak the fine sand I am using to fill them with. I carry them in my car. These bags are good in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: mjrodney

customer_reviews.title: White Sandbags
customer_reviews.text: I used these bags to put sand in as I will be moving. They were very sturdy and reliable and will definitely order more in the future. A great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Managing the sand like a pro!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting sand into these durable bags! The plastic string was a PLUS. Glad I made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Elmira Williams

customer_reviews.title: Transfers sand well
customer_reviews.text: I mean... what else can you say... they’re sandbags! Great for transferring sand I must say! I had to transfer sand for my child’s sandbox and this did the job
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Lim

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Used these to anchor our tent while camping on the beach. They worked well and are sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Credx2

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfect for hurricane Dorian. They were a life saver. Cannot comment on longevity since I have only had them a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: These sand bags are exactly as advertised. They showed up quickly and the quality is just right for the application (bags that hold sand). My only advice is to by double what you think you need since the sand expands the bags and makes them cover less than you’d expect. I bought for my double wide garage door and 10 bags covered a little more than half.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using as extra weight in truck
customer_reviews.text: Came as described and easy to use. I bought 50 lbs bags of sand from Lowe’s ($6 each) and each of these bags held the full amount of sand. I’m using these as extra weight in the bed of my truck so cannot verify how well they work with blocking water. These were just what I was looking for and worked just as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rose

customer_reviews.title: Go for it !
customer_reviews.text: Decent price, seem to be well made. I switched from a sand filter to a cartridge filter for the pool last year and had put the sand in used plastic bags which do not last long. These look like they will and they look the same as I filled at Fort Drum excepting the color. Using them to protect the pool hoses near a walkway.
customer_reviews.author: Jill A. James

customer_reviews.title: Held up well!
customer_reviews.text: Used these as anchors for an awning at the beach and the worked great. Filled and refilled them several times over the course of the week and passed them on to another family when we left. No issues with the sun, no holes or tears. Nice wide openings and overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very strong. Used them to weigh down sand bags for my outdoor umbrella base, perfect
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Walker

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money 👌
customer_reviews.text: Grat purchase for good price. Exactly what we need for our home for hurricane season.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I wanted, only wish opening was ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I wanted, only wish opening was bigger. I could not use my shovel to get dirt in. I had to use my garden trowel to fill with dirt+rocks. That made filling each bag much longer and tiring.
customer_reviews.author: Johann

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sand bags
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace some of my worn bags that are used to keep my winter pool cover in place. These fit the bill nicely. Seem like they will last a couple seasons at least.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: AAA+++ filled up with sand and they are doing what I need them to do, which is hold down my outdoor umbrella!
customer_reviews.author: Benne

customer_reviews.title: Nice bundle size
customer_reviews.text: This product works great, we had to replace a lot of aging sand bags for storm protection. We transfer the sand from the old bags over to new ones each year as needed. The cost savings of ordering the 50 ct bundle is great for this purpose and will last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Randall R

customer_reviews.title: Straps held
customer_reviews.text: Living in Florida we are subject to heave downpours, the bags keep water out of the garage
customer_reviews.author: Russ L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon saved the day and great product worked well
customer_reviews.text: A real heart felt thanks ordered day before hurricane and in my hand next day filled and used. Thanks product worked perfectly. Oh delivered 4 days early .
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wait in line!
customer_reviews.text: We live on the water and having sandbags is a must. These are just like the ones they pass out when you are in line to fill your sand bags. Skip the line on waiting to get your sandbags and go right to the pile of sand! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Alexsy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Used them to hold down a patio umbrella. I “ doubled up on the bags” to delay deterioration from UV light.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph V. Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Good weight!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a very hilly area and have an old and small truck. In the winter my husband puts sand in the back of the truck to steady it. He keeps the bags in closed plastic containers and it's a lot easier (and neater) to lift the bags out when the weather warms up.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Ann

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy rips very easily, sand leaks out every time....
customer_reviews.text: not sturdy rips very easily, sand leaks out every time....
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use them to discard concrete and paver debris for the trash folks to pick up. Heavy stuff that typical yard waste bags can’t handle. They work great. Easily hold 30+ pounds of stuff with no tearing from sharp edges of debris.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: Empty bags
customer_reviews.text: Had to get rid of a sandbox and I didn’t want to Shawshank all the sand into my garbage. Used these so I have some outdoor weights for my patio furniture
customer_reviews.author: Callcube

customer_reviews.title: Sandbags
customer_reviews.text: Knowing nothing about sandbags. I think these bags are excellent for storing my lava cinders. Only time will tell how really good these bags are.
customer_reviews.author: aloha

customer_reviews.title: tore almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I used these for holding row covers down over plants. After just a couple of months, they would tear when I tried to move them. All that work to fill them and now they are trash. Would never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Golfmom1

customer_reviews.title: I hate reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I said I was happy, I shouldn’t have to write a review.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Rother

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I only just finished filling and placing them so cannot attest to their long term durability, but so far they have proved perfect for the job intended.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Mather

customer_reviews.title: Great bags for sand
customer_reviews.text: Great bags for sand, sturdy, and perfect size. The provided ties are also super handy. Product description is spot on too, as many bags pop up in searches and one can easily end up w nice burlap bags not appropriate for sand...
customer_reviews.author: Mid

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: They have been doing fine for me I’m a happy customer
customer_reviews.author: benjamin lepley

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Worked as desired. I used some to cover up handicap signs in a parking lot that is under construction.
customer_reviews.author: TheDistance

customer_reviews.title: Real nice
customer_reviews.text: I filled these bags with hair clippings that I have been collecting for decades and they really worked great. I supposed they’d also work with sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just in case....
customer_reviews.text: Now I have these if we are warned of a flash flood. Our commercial building is in a low lying spot and filling these with sand and having them on standby gives us peace of mind should we ever need them. We hope to never use them but we are prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Murph A

customer_reviews.title: Too early to know
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet used these bags, will need to come back later and reevaluate. They look good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UpNorth Sand Bags used by Harvey volunteers!
customer_reviews.text: UpNorth sand bags are being used by homeowners in Woodforest Subdivision, Montgomery, TX. We had not yet used the bags so donated them to volunteers filling pillow cases, garbage bags, and any other bag to protect homes from encroaching flood waters. They were very happy to receive the "real thing".
customer_reviews.author: judith bryan
